trans-unit.source: Represents the style for a <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Panel"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> class is used to represent the style settings for a panel control.
It encapsulates the properties that control the appearance of a panel and can be applied to multiple panel controls to provide a common appearance.
You can specify an image to display in the background of the panel by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.BackImageUrl%2A> property.
The horizontal alignment of the contents of the panel is indicated by the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.HorizontalAlign%2A> property.
The direction of controls that contain text within the panel control can be specified by setting the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.Direction%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle"></xref> class.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.StateBag"></xref> object that represents the state bag in which to store style information.
Gets or sets the URL of the background image for the panel control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.BackImageUrl%2A> property specifies the URL of the background image for the panel control.
For this property to work, an image file must exist at the specified location.
If the specified image file is not accessible, then the panel control is displayed without a background image.
The URL of the background image for the panel control.
The default value is an empty string ("").
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.BackImageUrl"></xref> property is `null`.

Duplicates the style properties of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object for the current instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle"></xref> class.

You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.CopyFrom%2A> method to duplicate the style settings of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object for the current instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> class.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.CopyFrom%2A> method copies non-blank elements from the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object, `s`.
Any element that is defined in `s` replaces any element that is defined in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> object.
To replace only those style settings left blank in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> object, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.MergeWith%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object that represents the style settings to copy.
Gets or sets the direction in which to display controls that include text in a panel control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.Direction%2A> property specifies the direction in which to display controls that include text in a panel control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.Direction%2A> property is set using one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ContentDirection> values.
The following table lists the possible values.
Value
Description
The content direction is not set.
Child controls that include text are displayed from left to right.
Child controls that include text are displayed from right to left.
If you specify <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ContentDirection.LeftToRight>, child controls that include text display from left to right.
If you specify <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ContentDirection.RightToLeft>, child controls that include text display right to left.
Use <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ContentDirection.RightToLeft> to display text for languages that are written from right to left, such as Arabic or Hebrew.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ContentDirection"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ContentDirection.NotSet"></xref>.
The direction is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ContentDirection"></xref> values.
Gets or sets the horizontal alignment of the contents within a panel control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.HorizontalAlign%2A> property specifies the horizontal alignment of the contents within a panel control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.HorizontalAlign%2A> property is set using one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign> enumeration values.
The following table lists the possible values.
Value
Description
The horizontal alignment is not set.
The contents of the panel are left-aligned.
The contents of the panel are centered.
The contents of the panel are right-aligned.

If the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.HorizontalAlign%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign.NotSet> but the property is set in the control that contains the panel control, the setting is inherited from the containing control.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign.NotSet"></xref>.
The horizontal alignment is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.HorizontalAlign"></xref> values.

Combines the style settings of the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object with the current instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle"></xref> class.

You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.MergeWith%2A> method to combine the style settings of the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object with the current instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> class.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.MergeWith%2A> method copies non-blank elements from the specified <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style> object, `s`, but does not replace any existing style settings in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> object.
To replace the style settings in the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> object with the style settings in `s`, use the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.CopyFrom%2A> method.
A <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.Style"></xref> object that represents the style settings to combine with the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle"></xref> object.
Removes any defined style settings from the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle"></xref> class.
You can use this method to remove any defined style settings from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle> class.
Gets or sets the visibility and position of scroll bars in a panel control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.ScrollBars%2A> property specifies the visibility and position of scroll bars in a panel control.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.ScrollBars%2A> property is set using one of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ScrollBars> enumeration values.
The following table lists the possible values.
Value
Description
No scroll bars are shown.
Only a horizontal scroll bar is shown.
Only a vertical scroll bar is shown.
Both horizontal and vertical scroll bars are shown.
If necessary, horizontal, vertical, or both scroll bars are shown.
Otherwise, no scroll bars are shown.
One of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ScrollBars"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ScrollBars.None"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.ScrollBars"></xref> property is not one of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ScrollBars"></xref> values.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the content wraps within the panel.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.Wrap%2A> property indicates whether the content wraps within the panel.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.Wrap%2A> property is set to `false` and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.ScrollBars%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ScrollBars.Auto>, if the content of the panel is longer than what will fit in the panel, the content of the panel will appear on one line with a horizontal scroll bar.

When the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.Wrap%2A> property is set to `false` and the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.PanelStyle.ScrollBars%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ScrollBars.None>, the panel will extend and if necessary the Web page will have a horizontal scroll bar.
`true` if the content wraps within the panel; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
